Adult male.description: Adult male Lesser Goldfinches have a complete black crown unlike the partial crown seen on adult male American Goldfinches. They also lack the American Goldfinch's bright yellow back.

Female/immature.description: Female Lesser Goldfinches have a white rectangle on the wings that female American Goldfinches lack. They also have yellow undertail coverts, whereas the undertail coverts on American Goldfinches are white.

Male.description: Male Lawrence's Goldfinches are grayer overall than American Goldfinches with a black face not seen on either female or male American Goldfinches.

Female.description: Female Lawrence's Goldfinches have a gray head and back, whereas female American Goldfinches have a yellow head and olive back.

Adult (Northern).description: Pine Siskins have coarse brown streaks on the breast and back unlike the unstreaked American Goldfinch.

Adult male.description: Evening Grosbeaks are about twice the size of a goldfinch, with a huge bill and large white wing patches rather than wingbars seen on American Goldfinches.
